title: Rubell Museum DC Brings Contemporary Art to Washington
description: The Rubells open a new contemporary art museum, extending their reach to the capital with some 200 works and a nod to Marvin Gaye.
dc:creator: Robin Pogrebin
media:credit: Justin T. Gellerson for The New York Times
media:description: The Rubell family — Jason, Mera and Donald — with Vaughn Spann’s “Big Black Rainbow (Smoky Eyes)” in the new Rubell Museum DC. The inaugural show, “What’s Going On,” is named for Marvin Gaye, who attended school in the original building.
